dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: The type locality was a small creek, 1-2 m wide, 0.1-0.3 m deep; sandy bottom with some aquatic vegetation, in a cultivated area; located in a deep groove, covered by trees.  Also collected from a relatively large stream and from a spring fed reservoir, up to 2 m deep (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Mae Nam Mae Khlong River basin, Thailand.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Morphology
dataObjects.description: Dorsal spines (total): 16 - 17; Dorsal soft rays (total): 8 - 10; Analsoft rays: 7 - 8; Vertebrae: 27 - 28

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. and R. Britz 2002 Revision of the family Badidae (Teleostei: Perciformes), with description of a new genus and ten new species. Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 13(4):295-372. (Ref. 46238)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Possesses a dark blotch on the dorsolateral aspect of the caudal peduncle present.  Postorbital stripe angled.  Rounded caudal fin; blotch on caudal peduncle small and confined to the side of the caudal peduncle.  Absence of a pattern of horizontal rows alternating light and dark stripes along side and absence of prominent dark spots in vertical bars or horizontal rows.  Dark bar entirely across the caudal fin base with the dorsalmost portion darker and separated from the rest by light band instead of the 3 dark blotches in most Badis species.  Scales in lateral row 27-28 (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.references: Kullander, S.O. and R. Britz 2002 Revision of the family Badidae (Teleostei: Perciformes), with description of a new genus and ten new species. Ichthyol. Explor. Freshwat. 13(4):295-372. (Ref. 46238)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#TrophicStrategy
dataObjects.description: The type locality was a small creek, 1-2 m wide, 0.1-0.3 m deep; sandy bottom with some aquatic vegetation, in a cultivated area; located in a deep groove, covered by trees. Also collected from a relatively large stream, 10-20 m wide; a large side pool (30-40 m diameter) with standing water downstream of the bridge, immediately downstream of a stretch of riffles, in a large area with dense permanent submerse vegetation, about 1 m deep. Also collected from a spring fed reservoir, with very clear, cold water, and dense aquatic vegetation, up to 2 m deep (Ref. 46238).

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Allen, D. 2012. Badis khwae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2012

Assessor/s
Allen, D.

Reviewer/s
Smith, K. & Ng, H.H.

Contributor/s

Justification
Although the species appears to be endemic to the Khwae Noi River basin in western Thailand (and possibly associated drainages in Myanmar), the species has no known threats aside from river damming and it has been found to be present in an artificial reservoir. It is assessed as Least Concern at present, however it should be reassessed if further information becomes available.
